p.span: The J.O Combs Unified School District continues to monitor and communicate with local and state officials regarding the new Coronavirus, which causes a disease known as COVID-19, and will continue to follow their professional guidance. As this is a rapidly evolving situation globally, we will continue to update this resource for families with the most up to date information.

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

a.span: You may also click here to view this content as a Google Doc.

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: Are there any confirmed cases of COVID-19 (Coronavirus) in the J.O. Combs Unified School District?

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: We currently do not have any confirmed cases of COVID-19 reported in our District.

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: How long will schools be closed?

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: On March 30, the

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; -webkit-text-decoration-skip: none; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

a.span: Governor and the Arizona Department of Education announced the extension of Arizona school closures through the end of the school year

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: . The extension follows updated guidance from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and an announcement from the White House extending physical distancing guidelines until April 30, 2020. The closure includes all schools, Combs Kidz childcare, in-state and out of state field trips, all athletic practices and events, facility rentals, performances, clubs and extracurricular activities and any other school-sponsored events.

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: Will meals continue to be provided for students?

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Due to rising temperatures posing challenges for food storage, we will be changing the way breakfast and lunch meals are distributed.

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: Starting Monday, April 27, both breakfast and lunch will be handed out together from 7:30 am to 9am during curbside meal service at Simonton Elementary

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: . Parents will receive both meals together along with instructions for how to cook any hot items for lunch. Kathryn Sue Simonton Elementary is located at 40300 N Simonton Blvd., San Tan Valley, AZ 85140. Anyone ages 18 or younger is eligible to participate.

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Due to federal Summer Food Program guidelines, the only site currently eligible to distribute meals is Simonton Elementary. Anyone 18 and under, regardless of neighborhood or school attendance, is welcome to participate in this program. More information will be shared if/when additional meal resources become available at other sites.

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Community members who wish to donate food items for families in need are encouraged to do so at one of many

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; -webkit-text-decoration-skip: none; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: . Families who are not eligible for the meal program at Simonton Elementary are also encouraged to contact their local food bank for food provisions.

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: Will the closure mean additional make-up days are added onto the year?

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: No. The State Legislature passed a bill stating that schools will not be forced to elongate the school year in order to make up for the instructional time lost as a result of the statewide school closures.

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: Will teachers and staff be paid during the closure?

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Yes. Part of Governor Ducey’s announcement included a commitment to work together to make sure dedicated school employees don’t see any disruption to their pay. On Tuesday, March 18,

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: the District’s Governing Board held a special meeting to approve a resolution to continue to pay staff during the closure. Additional details regarding employee expectations and payroll arrangements have been, and will continue to be, communicated directly to staff.

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: What should families be doing during the closure?

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: In order to maintain the safety, health, and well-being of our students, staff and school community, we continue to encourage families to abide by the most recent recommendations of the

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; -webkit-text-decoration-skip: none; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: and

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; -webkit-text-decoration-skip: none; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: This includes practicing “social distancing”, limiting social interactions with others, and staying home.

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; -webkit-text-decoration-skip: none; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: such as handwashing, covering coughs and sneezes, and avoiding high touch areas should also be encouraged.

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: What will instruction look like for students during the closure?

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Starting April 1st, we will officially begin online learning, providing our curriculum remotely via online lessons, videos, and other educational resources. You will receive detailed information from your teacher about how to access these resources, as well as grading, attendance, and more. Please note that this online instruction is considered curriculum and will count toward your student’s grade/credit. For those of you who cannot readily access online instruction, hard copies of resources will be made available.

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: How does the closure affect students with IEPs of 504 plans?

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: The District is committed to continuing the services and adaptations identified on your child's IEP or Section 504 plan as appropriate. The Section 504 coordinator and Special Education Teachers are collaborating with their general education counterparts to ensure adaptations are incorporated within our transition to remote instruction. Your child's special education teacher is planning the delivery of IEP services and will be working with you to determine what is appropriate. All IEP and MET meetings will continue via videoconferencing or telephonically. If your child's IEP or MET meeting had to be rescheduled, your child's team will be contacting you to reschedule a time. The IEP that has been in place will continue. Any evaluations that require face to face testing and/or observation are not able to take place at this time to ensure the health and safety of all students, staff and families. The District is working on alternate ways to address this issue and will provide an update as it is available.

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: Will the District be providing technology devices to families without laptops or those who have children sharing one device?

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: The IT Department has completed four phases of laptop distribution for families who requested support with technology. Starting

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: the week of April 20, 2020, they will begin offering technical support to families on a

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: walk-in basis each Wednesday, from 3:30 to 5:30pm at t

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: . Initial requests for tech support should be directed to teachers, and if the issue requires additional assistance, families should seek support from the principal. The principal will connect the family with the IT Department to address the concern during the Wednesday walk-in days.

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: What if my family doesn’t have WiFi or internet?

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Families who have limited/no access to internet or WiFi are able to use a variety of free Cox hotspots located throughout the area. A map of the nearest hotspots can be

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; -webkit-text-decoration-skip: none; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: What are the expectations for students during remote learning? How much time per day, homework, etc?

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Your child’s teacher will be reaching out directly to provide details regarding instruction, standard operating procedures, assignments, and more. While remote learning is designed to continue your child’s academic progress, it is not intended to replicate the experience they would typically receive in a classroom. We understand this is a challenging time for families and students, and will build in as much flexibility as possible.

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Grading expectations have been established and updated to continue to ensure continued academic progress for students during remote learning. Grading expectations have been updated to include information on extra credit, and

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; -webkit-text-decoration-skip: none; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: . Additional clarification regarding grading on the Edgenuity platform for 7th-12th graders has also been developed and

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; -webkit-text-decoration-skip: none; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: As we continue to provide meaningful instruction for students, it is important that we balance the principles of accountability as well as flexibility and grace for our families during these uncertain times.

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: Is state testing still going to take place?

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: No, state testing has been canceled. When the Governor signed the School Closure bills on March 27, all state testing was officially canceled. Other testing, such as ACT and SAT, is currently being postponed. More information will be shared as it is received.

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: How do the closures affect athletics?

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: The Arizona Interscholastic Association (AIA) has canceled all spring sports and spring football as a result of the school closures. Plans are being developed for the safe return of any sports equipment, and that information will be shared directly with those students by their coaches.

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: Will there still be a graduation ceremony for seniors?

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Due to the unknown duration of the COVID-19 safety restrictions, we have elected to concurrently plan for two possible graduation ceremony options. Should the government orders allow us to host an in-person graduation, and we are able to safely do so, we will be prepared to host a traditional ceremony for our students on May 19th. However because we recognize that this may not be possible, we are also preparing for a virtual graduation ceremony.

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: We will make a formal announcement around May 1st when there is more clarity from the state and nation. We know how important this milestone is for our students and families, and will make every effort possible to make this a memorable celebration for our seniors and their loved ones.

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Prom has been canceled but may potentially be rescheduled based on the duration of social distancing recommendations.

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: Can I still enroll my child for next year even though school is closed?

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Enrollment for the 2020-2021 school year is now open. In order to maintain the health and safety of our students and families, the J.O. Combs Unified School District has created a

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; -webkit-text-decoration-skip: none; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: to allow families to enroll students from the safety of their homes. On that portal, you will find everything you need to register your child online or set up an in-person enrollment appointment.

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: How can I pick up my students’ personal items from their school/classroom?

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: We have established processes and guidelines to ensure students and families can safely pick up personal items from their school sites during the first two weeks of May, as well as return school property such as library books, textbooks, and sports equipment.

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

em.span: Please note that the return of these items does not indicate the end of the school year, and that remote instruction will still continue through May.

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Starting April 27, you will receive a detailed email from the principal of your child’s school with information about what should be returned and picked up, as well as instructions on how to sign up for a time slot. All procedures for this process have been developed in compliance with social distancing practices and CDC cleanliness recommendations.

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: How do I return checked out items/books?

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Items that are necessary for continued instruction, such as textbooks, will not have to be returned until the end of the year. Other checked out equipment like library books, CTE items, etc, will need to be returned to the school site. School principals will share details regarding dates, times, and social distancing precautions to allow families to return these items.

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Pre-orders for yearbooks will still be filled, and arrangements for drive-through pick up will be shared by your school’s principal when the yearbooks arrive.

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: How can I make sure I receive the latest updates and communication during the closures?

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: The District will continue to share regular updates with families via SchoolMessenger, as well as social media and the website. If you have not been receiving messages through SchoolMessenger, but from a friend or neighbor, please contact the Principal of your child's school to ensure that your correct email address is on file. Schools and teachers will also be using email as a primary means of communicating with families, so it is critical that this information is accurate.

span.style: font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

br.span: We are reaching out because you have likely been hearing reports in the news regarding the Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19). The J.O. Combs Unified School District has reached out to the Pinal County Public Health Department and will continue to follow their guidance and recommendations regarding the COVID-19 outbreak. At this time, there are no confirmed cases in our district, however we recognize that recent reports identify a case in our nearby community and that this issue continues to rapidly evolve statewide.

span.style: font-size: 10pt

span.style: font-size: 10pt

br.span: We want to remind our school community that the best ways to prevent the spread of COVID-19 are the same as preventing the cold and flu, and include:

span.style: font-size: 10pt

br.span: ● Frequently washing your hands with soap and water.

span.style: font-size: 10pt

br.span: ● Covering your mouth when you sneeze or cough.

span.style: font-size: 10pt

br.span: ● Avoiding touching your eyes, nose, and mouth.

span.style: font-size: 10pt

br.span: ● Cleaning and disinfecting frequently touched objects and surfaces using a regular household cleaning

span.style: font-size: 10pt
font-size: 10pt

br.span: ● Avoiding close contact with people who are sick.

span.style: font-size: 10pt

br.span: ● Staying home when you are sick.

span.style: font-size: 10pt
span.em: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) does not recommend the use of facemasks for the general public.

span.style: font-size: 10pt

br.span: The safety, health, and well-being of our students, staff and school community will, as always, continue to be our priority. During Spring Break the District will conduct a deep cleaning of all classrooms, schools and departments.

span.style: font-size: 10pt

div.span: The District will also establish enhanced daily cleaning of high-touch surfaces and incorporate routine hand hygiene practices throughout the day when students return.

span.style: font-size: 10pt

br.span: We will continue monitoring the development of COVID-19 and plan accordingly in partnership with local, state, and federal health and government officials. We have also developed a list of frequently asked questions (FAQs) with additional information.
